educational_objective: Diagnose lytic lesions of multiple myeloma.
question_text: A 69-year-old man is evaluated for anemia and arm pain.A radiograph of the right humerus is shown.
question_stem: Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
critique: The most likely cause of the radiographic findings is multiple myeloma (Option B). This image shows punched-out lytic lesions of the humerus. Lytic lesions are found in nearly 60% of patients with multiple myeloma and most frequently involve the vertebral bodies, skull, thoracic cage, pelvis, and proximal humeral and femoral bones. In contrast, bone lesions in metastatic prostate cancer and Paget disease tend to have significant osteoblastic changes, whereas osteomyelitis is marked by periosteal reaction and bone destruction.
